content: hey friends no I haven't switched over to the babysitting channel this is

table and start making these into usable cards for our games
hey guys here's my party favor the little bub basket here and I'm gonna
take the top cover off hums pop that just pops right off and I'm going to
take the handle and switch it around like that okay
so now I'm going to put glue that in place with my e6000 and this works great
on projects like this it really works on this kind of plastic stuff all kinds of
interesting materials so was it glue that upside down then we're going to put
some more glue on the handle here because I'm gonna put a seat and I have
this rectangular wood piece but you could use craft sticks or anything like
that so I'm just gonna get it level and let it dry up cool now I'm going to
cover up those holes with my glue gun just kind of squirt a little glue in the
hole and blend it into the cart the weavings of the cart so it kind of
blends in and matches alright sweet now I'm gonna use these tapered craft sticks
with my white glue because I want to have enough time to work with them get
them the right angle on the cart so if I use the word the hot glue it would be a
little harder so I was just gonna use a white glue to get them right just hold
it for a few seconds and it'll be good alright sweet now I'm gonna use this
piece of cardstock and it's going to be kind of the harness for the horse so
I'll just kind of bend it around in a loop so it kind of goes over the two

right I'm gonna go under the bar okay cool so once I get that set I'll just

a bit or the harness up a bit with some white glue just use my brush painted on
a little bit of water to help spread it out
cool really shaping up into a wagon here all right now I'm going to use some goop
this is actually real group 96,000 but I get these little rhinestones I'm going
to use these as bolts to hold on the harness so I'll just kind of put them on
where the cardstock meets the bar there and I'll give a nice illusion that
they're bolted on that the harness is bolted on there we go nice okay now it's
paint time so I black bombed it with a flat black spray-paint and I'm going to
use a lighter kind of wood Brown and I'm just gonna kind of dry brush because I
really want all that nice detail that I've got on the card itself
okay so I was paint it all up because it kind of has almost like a woven wood
texture on it which is really nice I do my owl planks
on the seat just paint separate planks with the brush there paint underneath
the same underneath just kind of simulate the planks all right now I'm
going to use a lighter brown and kind of highlight some of those that would so go
along some edges and along some planks exterior really start to pick out that
detail that little extra level of color difference really really adds to a piece
all right looking really good really happy all right sweet
now I'm going to use a little bit of a lighter kind of a leathery Brown for the
harness so and then we'll be done and I'll show it to you at the table nice
here we have our little cart coming down the road and we have a good old Roderick

love these horses these are great for these carts and waggons
and I had a little bit of treats in the back so we'll just take those out and

Turner and that's really fun just a really quick easy project for a little
